availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: William H. Norton (Mercer County, Kentucky, farmer and 2nd lieutenant in 11th Kentucky Cavalry (U.S.A.))

body.p: Mercer County, Kentucky, farmer and soldier. Kentucky native. Son of Asbury Norton and Mary Norton. Married to Mary H. Norton. Father of Berry C. Norton, Mary B. Norton, and William R. Norton. Farmer in Mercer County in 1850. Farmer in Mercer County in 1860. Served in the 11th Kentucky Cavalry Regiment (U.S.A.) as second lieutenant from September 22, 1862, to April 22, 1864.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Mercer County, District 2, p. 327A.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Mercer County, District 2, p. 638.
Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Mercer County, Precinct 2, p. 462A.
Report of the Adjutant General of the State of Kentucky, vol. 1, 1861-1866 (Frankfort: Kentucky Yeoman Office, 1866), 280.
Compiled Service Records of Volunteer Union Soldiers who Served in Organizations From State of Kentucky, NARA RG 94, Microfilm Series M397, Roll 110.
Find A Grave, "William Hickerman Norton (1833-1873)," Memorial #35989279, http://www.findagrave.com/memorial/35989279 (accessed December 9, 2020).
